title: How do I deal with the Corona pandemic?
author: Dr Wolfgang Schachinger
description: The fourth Corona wave has reached Austria with full force. Many people have not yet recovered from the restrictions of the first three pandemic peaks. Now it seems that everything is getting worse than ever before. Countless emails and phone calls from people who have not yet made a decision regarding vaccination reached us in the last few days. We have been even more touched by the many messages and phone calls from people who have contracted Corona and cannot find any companionship in their emergency situation. We have therefore revised our recommendations for the prevention and complementary treatment of Corona and are pleased to make them available to you. The restrictions caused by the new lockdown, the fear of the disease, the pressure to make decisions regarding vaccination or the disease itself hit us all hard. How can we deal with this? Our first reaction at the beginning of the pandemic in March 2020 was an appeal to you to care more about health and positive aspects of life. Darkness does not disappear if you fight it with the means of darkness. Only light defeats darkness.Behavior in Lockdown Having only recently regained the small freedoms of our lives, they are now once again a distant memory. The feeling of isolation creates fear and anxiety in many people. What can you do when you're not allowed to attend events or meet friends? How to deal with fear and anger about the situation? Fear limits us and paralyzes us. Getting active is an important way out of fear. If fears and worries plague you, it's important to keep breaking out of the negative thought spiral. You can do this in two ways: By keeping yourself busy with positive things. You can write down your pleasant experiences every day to reinforce them. This is done by keeping a "happiness diary". In it, you jot down daily activities that have gone well for you, experiences that have done you good, and anything for which you are grateful. And there's plenty of that every day. If you have learned a form of meditation (we recommend Transcendental Meditation), be especially regular in your practice now, and perhaps spend a little more time on it than usual. Any form of exercise alleviates anxiety and worry. Even in lockdown, it is permissible to exercise outdoors for personal regeneration. Go for a walk or jog without overexerting yourself. Or practice yoga or other physical exercises at home. Is there still an unused piece of fitness equipment somewhere? Then now is high time to get back to using it daily. Engaging with Health Our Health NOW webinar was created in the first lockdown to provide you with valuable health knowledge in a compact format. You can access it now at a special price and learn the best health tips from Maharishi Ayurveda on your own or with your whole family. Do you prefer to read books on health? Take advantage of the rich selection in our shop. Also try to implement what you have learned in your life as soon as possible. Vaccination - yes or no? Currently many people are burdened by the pros and cons of vaccinations. Almost every conversation with previously unvaccinated patients and countless emails or phone calls revolve around this topic. The massive push by authorities to vaccinate on the one hand, and warnings of possible side effects of vaccination on the other, contribute much to the divide. Official statistics show that vaccinated people are on average less likely to contract covid and less severe. Reported fates of side effects after Corona vaccinations and frequent vaccine breakthroughs make it difficult for many of us to make a decision. We do not have a universal answer to this. What seems important to us is this: Everyone will go through a Corona infection in the next few months or years - either in the form of Covid or in the form of a vaccination. For both cases, it is absolutely essential to prepare the immune system as best as possible to avoid disaster. If you don't do this, you run the risk of exposing yourself to a serious health risk in both cases. Strengthening the Immune System In several newsletters, we have reported how it is possible to strengthen the immune system. Pay attention to the fact that this is a holistic process that does not depend only on a pill, but essentially on our lifestyle. Those who are exhausted, not in balance, whose micronutrients are depleted, are much more at risk than people who maintain a balanced rhythm of life with sufficient rest and relaxation, regular regenerative sport and exercise, moderate nutrition and seasonal purification.

Hans-Albert Müller schrieb am 29.11.2021
Nochmal zu Alois und seinen Zweifeln an der Impfung aufgrund der genannten Zahlen in Irland:
Irland hat eine Impfquote von 76% (vollständig geimpft) und derzeit eine "7-Tage-Inzidenz" von 624 (Stand 29.11.2021). Link: https://www.corona-in-zahlen.de/weltweit/irland/
Du sprichst von Irland als einem Land mit "einer sehr hohen Durchimpfungsrate". 76% hört sich erstmal viel an, ist aber für die Delta-Variante des Virus - die inzwischen hauptsächlich vorkommt und 6 mal infektiöser ist als das "Original" - keine ausreichende Impfquote. Die muss bei 90% liegen. Durch die Delta-Variante liegt der Reproduktionswert eines Infizierten also 6 mal höher als noch in 2020. Das erklärt die derzeit hohen Infektionszahlen. Klar "Impfdurchbrüche" gibt es auch. Es wurde auch nie behauptet, dass eine Impfung sicher davor schützt, sich zu infizieren. Die Impfung schützt mit einer sehr hohen Sicherheit im Falle einer Infektion vor einem schweren Verlauf - also vor Krankenhausaufenthalt, Intensivstation mit "Long Covid-Symptomen" oder Tod - unter der Voraussetzung, dass das Immunsystem nicht durch Vorerkrankungen oder chronische Krankheiten stark geschwächt ist. Und hier kommt dann wieder der Ayurveda-Ansatz ins Spiel: Man kann neben einer Impfung sehr viel tun, um sein Immunsystem fit zu halten oder zu machen. Hierzu rate ich, die Empfehlungen der Drs. Schachinger zu befolgen, was nichts anderes bedeutet, als dass man darauf achtet, dass es einem gut geht. D. h. letztlich: Die Impfung ist nur EIN Baustein, aber m. E. ein wichtiger, dem Virus zu begegnen. Ein weiterer ist es, auch trotz Impfung und "Immunsystem fit machen", in bestimmten Situationen die AHA-Regeln inklusive "Lüften" zu beachten.
So - jetzt halt ich aber die Klappe und wünsche Dir das Allerbeste.

Zum Thema "Übersterblichkeit", das von Alois angesprochen wurde, habe ich andere Infos. Demnach hat es in Mittel-Europa, vor allem aber in Süd-Amerika durchaus "Übersterblichkeit" gegeben, auch wenn der Wert in D nicht so deutlich ausgefallen ist:
"Bei 50 zusätzlichen Toten pro 100.000 Einwohnern habe Deutschland in der Pandemie eine geringere Übersterblichkeit erfahren als umliegende europäische Länder. Während im Westen (Niederlande, Frankreich) und im Süden (Schweiz, Österreich) etwa 100 pro 100.000 Menschen mehr starben als erwartet, stieg der Wert im Osten (Tschechien, Polen) auf über 300 zusätzliche Todesfälle. Im Norden, in Dänemark, lag die „Übersterblichkeit“ bei etwa minus einem Prozent. Ob es derartige Unterschiede auch innerhalb Deutschlands gab, ist aus den Daten nicht ersichtlich.
In Schweden – dem Land ohne Lockdown – lag die Übersterblichkeit mit etwa 90 zusätzlichen Toten zwar über der deutschen, aber unter der von Frankreich oder Österreich."
Für die in Mitteleuropa relativ geringe „Übersterblichkeit“ im Vergleich zu Süd-Amerika gibt es vor allem 2 Gründe: 1. Sind die europäischen Gesundheits-Systeme eher in der Lage, einen schweren Covid-19-Verlauf zu einem guten Ende zu führen. 2. Sind durch das verbreitete Tragen von Masken im Winter 2020/2021 Grippe-Infektionen und infolgedessen Grippe-Tote kaum aufgetreten.
Link des kompletten Artikels zum Nachlesen:
https://www.epochtimes.de/wissen/allgemein/globale-studie-zur-uebersterblichkeit-in-der-corona-pandemie-a3570156.html
oder
https://www.forschung-und-lehre.de/forschung/wo-durch-corona-mehr-menschen-starben-3904/
Und übrigens: Kürzlich wurde für D die Marke von 100.000 Toten "in Zusammenhang mit Covid-19" überschritten. "In Zusammenhang" heißt: Entweder "direkt an" oder "in Kombination mit anderen ernsten Vorerkrankungen". In Brasilien sind es über 600.000. Dort hat man aber, zumindest in Rio, durch eine massive Impfkampagne die Impfquote auf um die 90% gebracht und dadurch das Thema sehr gut in den Griff bekommen, ebenso wie z. B. in Portugal. Und genau das brauchen wir hier auch: Eine Impfquote von 90% Andernfalls werden wir von einer Welle in die nächste stolpern.

text:
How do I deal with the Corona pandemic?
The fourth Corona wave has reached Austria with full force. Many people have not yet recovered from the restrictions of the first three pandemic peaks. Now everything seems to be getting worse than it ever was before.
Countless e-mails and phone calls from people who have not yet made a decision regarding vaccination have reached us in the last few days. We have been even more touched by the many messages and phone calls from people who have contracted Corona and cannot find any companionship in their emergency situation. We have therefore revised
[our recommendations](mailto:office@ayurvedaarzt.at?subject=Vorbeugung%20%2F%20Empfehlungen%20bei%20Infekten&body=Bitte%20senden%20Sie%20mir%20die%20Empfehlungen%20der%20Komplement%C3%A4rmedizin%20bei%20Erkrankung%20einer%20Covid-Infektion%20und%20Vorbeugema%C3%9Fnahmen%20zu.%0A%0AMit%20freundlichen%20Gr%C3%BC%C3%9Fen) for the prevention and complementary treatment of Corona and are pleased to make them [available](mailto:office@ayurvedaarzt.at?subject=Vorbeugung%20%2F%20Empfehlungen%20bei%20Infekten&body=Bitte%20senden%20Sie%20mir%20die%20Empfehlungen%20der%20Komplement%C3%A4rmedizin%20bei%20Erkrankung%20einer%20Covid-Infektion%20und%20Vorbeugema%C3%9Fnahmen%20zu.%0A%0AMit%20freundlichen%20Gr%C3%BC%C3%9Fen) to you.
The restrictions due to the recent lockdown, the fear of the disease, the pressure to make decisions regarding vaccination or the disease itself hit us all hard.
How can we deal with this?
Our first reaction at the beginning of the pandemic in March 2020 was an appeal to you to care more about health and positive aspects of life.
Darkness does not disappear if you fight it with the means of darkness. Only light defeats darkness.
Behaviour in the Lockdown
Having only recently regained the small freedoms of our lives, they are now again a distant memory. The feeling of isolation creates fear and anxiety in many people. What can you do when you are not allowed to attend events or meet friends? How to deal with fear and anger about the situation?
Fear limits us and paralyses us. Becoming active is an important way out of fear. If fears and worries plague you, it is important that you repeatedly break out of the negative thought spiral. There are two ways to do this:
- By occupying yourself with positive things. You can write down your pleasant experiences every day and thereby reinforce them. This happens when you keep a "happiness diary". In it, you write down daily activities that have gone well for you, experiences that have done you good and everything for which you are grateful. And there are plenty of these every day.
If you have learned a form of meditation (we recommend Transcendental
[Meditation](https://transzendentalemeditation.at/geboltskirchen/)), then you should now be especially regular in your practice and perhaps also spend a little more time on it than usual.
- Any form of exercise alleviates anxiety and worry. Even in lockdown, it is permissible to exercise outdoors for personal regeneration. Go for a walk or jog without overexerting yourself. Or practise yoga or other physical exercises at home. Is there still an unused piece of fitness equipment somewhere? Then now is the time to start using it again every day.
Engage with health
Our
[webinar "Health NOW"](https://www.ayurvedawebinar.at/gesundheit-jetzt) was created in the first lockdown to provide you with valuable health knowledge in a compact form. You can access it now at a special price and learn the best health tips from Maharishi Ayurveda alone or with your whole family.
Do you prefer reading books on health? Take advantage of the
[rich selection in our shop](https://www.ayurvedashop.at/duefte-und-medien/buecher-und-musik/). Also try to implement what you have learned in your life as soon as possible.
Vaccination - yes or no?
Currently, many people are burdened by the pros and cons of vaccinations. Almost every conversation with previously unvaccinated patients and countless emails or phone calls revolve around this topic. The massive urging of the authorities to vaccinate on the one hand, and the warnings of possible side effects of vaccination on the other, contribute a lot to the division.
Official statistics show that on average, vaccinated people contract covid less frequently and less severely. Reported fates of side effects after Corona vaccinations and frequent vaccine breakthroughs make it difficult for many of us to make a decision.
We do not have a universally valid answer to this. What seems important to us is this: Everyone will go through a Corona infection in the next few months or years - either in the form of covid or in the form of vaccination. For both cases, it is absolutely necessary to prepare the immune system as well as possible to avoid disaster. Those who fail to do so run the risk of exposing themselves to serious health risks in both cases.
Strengthening the immune system
In several newsletters we have reported how it is possible to strengthen the immune system. Be aware that this is a holistic process that does not depend only on a pill, but essentially on our lifestyle. Those who are exhausted, not in balance, whose micronutrients are depleted, are much more at risk than people who maintain a balanced rhythm of life with sufficient rest and relaxation, regular restorative sport and exercise, moderate diet and seasonal purification.
An optimal supply of herbal agents and orthomolecular substances both improves the chances of only mildly contracting covid and of surviving vaccination with few side effects. Sufficient
[supplementation with vitamin D](/news/vitamin-d-und-das-risiko-von-covid-infektionen) plays an important role in this.
What to do if you get sick
Prevention through lifestyle and supplements is a crucial first step. If you get covid, conventional medicine does not give any recommendations for mild and moderate symptoms other than taking antipyretics.
We have summarised internationally proven recommendations from complementary medicine for you. In our guide, you will find recommendations for all stages of illness that can be cared for in home care.
[You are welcome to request these recommendations by email here.](mailto:office@ayurvedaarzt.at?subject=Vorbeugung%20%2F%20Empfehlungen%20bei%20Infekten&body=Bitte%20senden%20Sie%20mir%20die%20Empfehlungen%20der%20Komplement%C3%A4rmedizin%20bei%20Erkrankung%20einer%20Covid-Infektion%20und%20Vorbeugema%C3%9Fnahmen%20zu.%0A%0AMit%20freundlichen%20Gr%C3%BC%C3%9Fen)
Smiling helps
When you are once again full of fear and doubt, just smile again! If you stand above things with a smile, you will soon notice that fears dissolve and the sun shines again.
Don't let pandemic, lockdown and compulsory vaccination get you down!
